Descriptions: The Vault of Glass is a Vex structure.
It is unlike anything else in the universe of Destiny.
It exists outside conventional reality.
It resides in a pocket dimension.
This pocket dimension is where all timelines converge.
In the Vault, past, present, and future coexist simultaneously.
Actions taken within the Vault can ripple across reality.
The Vex have never fully been able to replicate these effects outside the Vault.
The Vault is not just a fortress.
It is a temporal crucible.
It is a place designed to test beings.
It can manipulate beings.
In some cases, it can erase beings from existence.
The Vault embodies the Vex philosophy of control.
It also embodies the Vex philosophy of inevitability.
This philosophy contrasts sharply with the Traveler’s Light.
The Traveler represents free will.
The Traveler also represents possibility.
Kabr entered the Vault.
He sacrificed himself to forge the Aegis.
He embedded his Light into the Vex constructs.
This act created a bridge between the Light and the Vex’s temporal manipulations.
Kabr’s body was destroyed.
His essence persists in the Vault through the Aegis.
Praedyth became trapped within the Vault.
He exists in the fractured corners of time.
Praedyth is not dead.
He is erased from conventional reality.
He is only remembered through residual memories within the Vault itself.
Pahanin emerged from the Vault.
He retained only partial memories of his companions.
Pahanin later created the weapon Super Good Advice.
This weapon was inspired by Kabr’s sacrifice.
Some fireteam members were erased entirely from existence.
The Vault has no record of their names.
They never truly existed outside of the event itself.
The Vault brings together all timelines into one unified space.
The Vex study these timelines.
They manipulate these timelines.
They attempt to impose deterministic order.
It can erase beings from reality.
It can rewrite timelines.
This reflects the Vex desire to control fate.
The Vault functions as a trial for the Light.
The Vex are obsessed with inevitability.
They seek to defeat any potential threat across all possible timelines.
The arrival of Guardians introduces variables the Vex cannot fully calculate.
The arrival of Guardians introduces variables the Vex cannot fully control.
The Vault is both a prison and a laboratory.
Time itself can be weaponized within the Vault.
The Deep Stone Crypt is a Golden Age facility on Europa.
It was created by Clovis Bray.
Clovis Bray was guided by visions from a mysterious anomaly.
The anomaly was a small black sphere connected to the Darkness.
Clovis sought a way to achieve eternal life.
He discovered the Castalia Macula.
There, he found a veiled statue called Clarity Control.
Clovis combined Vex technology and 'Vex milk' to stabilize Exo minds indefinitely.
He built the Crypt beneath Europa to protect this technology.
The Morning Star orbital station served as a failsafe for the Crypt.
House Salvation sought to exploit the Crypt centuries later.
They wanted to create Fallen Exos.
Atraks became the first Fallen Exo.
She fused her Fallen consciousness with Exo technology.
She used nanomachines and dark ether.
Taniks was similarly resurrected.
His resurrection used preserved remains and dark ether technology.
Clarity Control can manipulate energy.
It can sustain minds.
It may influence storms on Europa.
Europa’s thin atmosphere and ice shelves make it harsh.
Local storms may be influenced by Clarity Control, Vex activity, or cryovolcanism.
The Morning Star regulates the Crypt’s operations.
It safeguards the resurrection experiments.
Clovis Bray aimed for immortality.
Fallen experiments continued his work centuries later.
The Deep Stone Crypt is a Golden Age relic.
It combines human ambition, Fallen cunning, and mysterious cosmic forces.
The Garden of Salvation raid explores the Vex, Darkness, and Light.
The Garden is an ancient metaphysical space.
The Traveler embodies Light.
Entities like the Winnower embody Darkness.
The Black Garden is a Vex-created simulation of the Garden.
It contains flora, fauna, and structures influenced by Vex ideology.
The Black Garden channels Darkness.
It is hostile and metaphysically charged.
The Sol Divisive is a Vex faction within the Garden.
They diverged from standard Vex ideology.
They recognize the Garden cannot be conventionally simulated.
They worship Darkness.
They perform rituals to harness Darkness.
The Black Heart lies at the Garden’s center.
It channels Darkness into the Garden.
The Pyramid anchors the Garden’s reality.
It concentrates the Black Heart’s power.
Guardians enter the raid to disrupt Vex rituals.
They prevent further empowerment of the Black Heart.
They protect the balance of Light and Darkness.
Riven is the last Ahamkara.
She is dragon-like and acausal.
Riven survived the Great Hunt.
She influenced the Dreaming City.
She shaped Mara Sov’s plans.
Her corruption allowed Savathûn’s curse on the Dreaming City.
Riven became a Taken entity.
She retained self-awareness.
She acted as a Wish Dragon.
Her Wall of Wishes consists of 20 plates.
It can generate over four septillion combinations.
Riven manipulated wishes for her own ends.
Her legacy persists in the Ascendant Plane.
Guardians ultimately destroyed her corrupted heart in Last Wish.
